messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Not at all OT ot ot!
messages.msgSnippet: Well, what got my dander up was that about a month before the DC s song came out there was one by a male singer about how the guy found his cheating wife and
messages.messageBody:
Well, what got my dander up was that about a month before the DC's song
came out there was one by a male singer about how the guy found his
cheating wife and rammed his truck through the motel wall and killed them
both. No big deal, of course.

Geez, of course there isn't a word for hating men, if you say anything you
are male bashing. So here goes, MENapause, MENtal illness, PMS
(preMENstraul syndrome), seems MEN are the root of all our evils, shall I
go on <<<BEWG>>>

Lynda, who will now behave herself, maybe <g>

----------
> From: libbygirl <libbygirl@...>
> To: Unschooling-dotcom@egroups.com
> Subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Not at all OT ot ot!
> Date: Thursday, April 06, 2000 4:53 PM
>
> Lynda,
> I SO agree with you! It is enough to make intelligent, caring,
NON-paranoid
> women wonder if there really is a patriarchal plot! How come even "Living
> Doll" (you know that old Cliff Richard song? )well, its lyrics say "Gonna
> lock her up in a trunk/so no big hunk/can steal her away from me!"
Honestly
> once you start listening to lyrics it is amazing how misogynist they are
and
> yet witness all the outrage over one song that paints a different
picture?
> GRRRRRRR
> By the way, ever notice that there is no word for someone who dislikes
men?
> I know there is man-hater but that is a "made-up word" if you will. It is
OK
> to be misanthropic (hate everyone) or misogynist (hate women) but hating
> Just men??? nah, why would anyone?? (Sarcastic voice and mean eyes!!)
> For every one film like Thelma and Louise (in which I think they killed
one
> maybe two men and yet the movie critics etc referred to their "murderous
> rampage!!!") there are hundreds that depict women being disrespected,
> assaulted, raped or killed! I am NOT advocating that we make more films
> showing women abusing or assaulting men - just pointing out that even
today
> women's mistreatment is the norm.
>
>
> Namaste
> Brooke
>
>

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Not at all OT ot ot!
messages.msgSnippet: I don t like seeing anyone kill anyone; but I have to say Thelma and Louise is a GREAT movie!
messages.messageBody:
I don't like seeing anyone kill anyone; but I have to say Thelma and Louise
is a GREAT movie!
